sentence.text: Absence epilepsy (AE) is a common type of genetic gentranscription by RNA polymerase IIlized epilepsy (GGE), particularly in children.

By creating new Pcnxl2 frameshift alleles using TALEN mutagenesis, we show that Pcnxl2 deficiency is responsible for mitigating the seizure phenomuscle organ development - making Pcnxl2 the first known modifier gene for absence seizures in any species.
